intro: Schimperella verrucosa, commonly known as the woolly false nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are typically covered in fine, soft pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on slender pedicels. Schimperella verrucosa is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 60 cm in height, with a somewhat sprawling growth habit.
